pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.52: Sp 1.400: Sāṭakapattoti lohapattasadiso susaṇṭhāno succhavi siniddho bhamaravaṇṇo mattikāpatto vuccati, “Sāṭakapatta: what is meant is a clay bowl like an iron bowl, which is well-formed, has a nice and glossy surface, and has the color of a bee.” Thig 13.1:1.1: Kāḷakā bhamaravaṇṇasādisā, “Black like the color of a bee.” It seems plausible that this kind of bowl was made of the ceramic that is now known among archeologists as “Northern Black Polished Ware”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss9:2.3.53: Sp 1.400: Sumbhakapattoti pakatimattikāpatto, “Sumbhakapatta: an ordinary clay bowl.”
